text.section: In this section, "insurable interest" means an actual, lawful, and substantial economic interest in the safety or preservation of the subject of the insurance against loss, destruction, or pecuniary damage or impairment to the property.

A contract of property insurance or a contract of insurance of an interest in or arising from property is enforceable only for the benefit of a person with an insurable interest in the property at the time of the loss.
An insurable interest in property is measured by the extent of possible harm to the insured from loss, injury, or impairment of the property.

section.section: This subsection applies only to an automobile insurance policy that is procured by an independent insurance producer.

text.section: An insurer may require written authorization from the insured before providing proof of insurance under this section to a person other than a financial institution.
